title: Miles2006
author: Miles2006
content: Have been wondering if Nigeria government makes bitcoin legalized, and if he does, will our marketers/traders accept bitcoin as exchange for buying of goods. Me I know naija very well, if government talk A we the citizens fit do B, na normal thing for naija. So we have been talking about bitcoin and the government gave deaf ear, but if government finally legalize bitcoin will our marketers accept bitcoin?From my paspective our marketers will not accept bitcoin as there currency. just like what have been saying we live in a digital dispensation and bitcoin has also contributed to our technology world today. And most of our marketers are not well educated about bitcoin, before owning bitcoin the person must have a knowledge about bitcoin, secondly bitcoin has to do with phones and Internet, traders in market will say they don't have android phones. And those business women will tell you straight to your face that they need fiat, some will tell you say them no go school. Just like wetin I talk when government talk A citizens go do B. I even remember last time wey our former president change the old currency and when I took the new naira note to the market, most traders rejected the money that the money looks fake and they will not accept the new naira note. scam: most traders for naija don decide say anything associated with phone and transfer na scam. Even some pos point no dey accept transfer, talkless of bitcoin. even if government legalize bitcoin that does not mean government will not take taxes, marketers are entitled to pay their tax. Of course government will not accept bitcoin as there tax payment. Marketers pay taxes with fiat currency and not with bitcoin, so traders will say they cannot receive bitcoin as there payment and pay fiat to the government. even pos systems does not accept bitcoin, most of our local traders doesn't have bank accounts, and when tranfering fiat currency we make use of the pos machine but how will it work if the pos machine doesn't have bitcoin or other cryptocurreny. bitcoin payment has no refunds, when the coin has been mistakenly transfer to another address then it is gone.

comments.author: Odohu
comments.body: Nigeria is a very dynamic country that welcomes innovations that make life easier. Take the case of conversion of generators to LPG powered system, electric powered vehicles that is popular in Bornu state and even the cashless policy that succeeded mostly in the northern part of the country where people least expected. What is holding Bitcoin from booming more than it is Nigeria is government disenchantment. Many people are still scared that their accounts and businesses will be attacked by government if they do business in Bitcoin. The moment government gives a go ahead to Bitcoin, you will see it spread like fire in Nigeria. It will become a new trend and you know Nigeria like trends. I am optimistic that the future of Bitcoin in Nigeria is bright, the awareness is there... just the government political will and approval is remaining.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Miles2006 on October 12, 2023, 07:18:22 PMHave been wondering if Nigeria government makes bitcoin legalized, and if he does, will our marketers/traders accept bitcoin as exchange for buying of goods. If Bitcoin is finally legalized as legal tender, for sure there will be people who will accept it and there will also be others who will prefer fiats to Bitcoin, and you can't force them, as it it their business and they have the right to decide what medium of payment they feel suitable for them.QuoteAnd those business women will tell you straight to your face that they need fiat, some will tell you say them no go school. Those who prefer fiat, fiat should be given, while those who prefer to buy/sell with BTC, so should BTC be given to them, it's shouldn't be a force, since its everybody's right to choose a choice of payment. Moreover, if Bitcoin finally gets legalized, so will the knowledge about it spread rapidly also, and as such it's not a matter anyone should worry about for now, as I'm sure it will always be accompanied by favorable policies.Quotemost traders for naija don decide say anything associated with phone and transfer na scam. Even some pos point no dey accept transfer, talkless of bitcoin.You just can't blame these people for believing everything to be a scam, as the environment they found themselves thought them the hard way

According to analysis of Nigeria illiteracy at least illetracy rate is now 31 percent at 2022 link ==> https://businessday.ng/news/article/nigerias-illiteracy-rate-is-now-31-says-fg/Quote from: Miles2006 on October 12, 2023, 07:18:22 PMI even remember last time wey our former president change the old currency and when I took the new naira note to the market, most traders rejected the money that the money looks fake and they will not accept the new naira note.[/li][/list]During the time of new Naira note adoption, I discovered that Nigerian marketers are very intelligent, and whatever they do, they do on porpose. And that made me come into conclusion that if Bitcoin is given a chance there will be mass adoption by the market people. One of the factor that affect marketers not to accept any new medium of exchange is scam. Market men and women are always tagged "local market women and uneducated" and people take advantage of there ignorance. Buy always defrauding them, which now made them skeptical about payment issue.Before anything spread across the country, market men and women will always be affected negatively. When the new Naira note was trending, scammers duplicated the new note and started making use of it in the market. before many people knew they were scammed of the hard earn money. In Mobile transfer many were given fake alert and so on. So this made many of them decide no to accept any online transactions.When there was naira scarcity, dey adopted online transactions, Â making use of POS machines. almost all of them in the market. so I started asking myself, is this not local market woman & man that are accepting online payment? So I concluded that when there is no other alternative, people must learn to adapt to a new way of life. So I concluded that illitracy was not there problem but fear of scam. Even if it's illitracy, the chances might be %70 %30.So with this little knowledge of mine, I Believe if Bitcoin is legalized, there will be mass adoption in the market sector.

comments.author: Justbillywitt
comments.body: Most marketers will accept bitcoin once it is legalize in Nigeria. However there will be some challenges, I still believe that the market women that sells most of the food stuffs we in our local markets will not accept bitcoin because of their literacy level. I see bitcoin being accepted in big establishments and a more organized sector than the street retailing shops. A pure water seller in the street of port Harcout will not accept bitcoin because they don't have smart phones and they most of them don't know what bitcoin is all about. Once it is legalized, those people that will accept bitcoin will make it open for the public to know they accept bitcoin. For example when you go to filling station to get fuel, you will see something like ''we accept bitcoin or pay with bitcoin''. Then gradually it will spread with time.

This companies can be payment processors that make payments in Bitcoin easier, dem fit get their pos machine and share am to market women to dey use accept payment and the cards been shared with the same marketing technique wey Opay dey use. Nigerian dey very innovative so make you no worry about adoption as we go work out way to make am a household accepted payment method by all including market women.Quotebitcoin payment has no refunds, when the coin has been mistakenly transfer to another address then it is gone.How dis one carry concern market women, shey all dey will be doing is accepting the payment and it can be converted directly to their bank account from the payment processors. Na only few OGs go dey still use the decentralized way of transacting for Bitcoin. Payment processing companies go come out wey you fit pay with Bitcoin but then exchange am immediately to Naira for their platforms so this women dem fit dey withdraw go their banks. This kind thing already they happen with other countries as Bitcoin can be received and converted to US dollars like ASAP.

It will also cream opportunities for others as their will be introduction of conversion platforms and they will possibly bring the education on how to accept that form of payment to everyone. The idea of it been a scam to some people will reduce when they see others accepting and it's working for them, they will just device a means against scammers to protect the market women and all other users. Conclusively, if Bitcoin is legalized it will only take a few time and it will be acceptable by almost everyone Once they know how well to receive money from the platform.

comments.body: My take be say we naija people sabi adapt, even if we no like wetin government bring, gradually we go just accept am and move on. Di start fit to de slow but eventually wey oda small businesses begin join di government to collect am, di remaining business people no go wan carry last, dem join di trend. Unto say bitcoin na currency wey fit to de appreciate for your hand, dat one na investment wey join di business wey person de do, because las las na to make profit be di koko of business people. comments.body: Legalizing Bitcoin will be good and beneficial to a lot marketersÂ  however, it may not be suitable for our common everyday market traders. comments.author: uchegod-21
comments.body: Marketers will definitely accept Bitcoin if legalised.Â  It might take time, but they will have no choice than to accept it.Â  The only challenge will be illiteracy. We are all Nigerians and we know majority of Nigerians like free or cheap things. No Nigerian will hear about doing transactions with Bitcoin and still ignore it. Especially with all the benefits Bitcoin has?Similar thing happened during the cashless policy, many market women and business men were forced to accept transfers as a means of payment or use pos to do transactions. At that point,Â  that was their only option if they must make sales. If not, there wereÂ  many competitors out there who would accept any means of payment provided they make sales.Â  If you can't beat them, you join them. Same will apply to Bitcoin.Â  Just like almost every shop in Nigeria have a POS device, so shall it be if bitcoin comes to stay. It will only take time for it to gain dominance. All the people will need is to be educated on how it works.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: OP, you should be specific with the kind of marketers that you are referring to, because if it is this petty traders that the total goods in their shop is around 5k-15k, I don't think that it will be wise for them to accept bitcoin because of the stress that they will pass through using it to refill their goods. This is because most of them buy their stuffs from the bush and also from illetrate like them that only believes in fiat. So such marketers will still be collecting fiat, even though bitcoin is legalized. Imagine that you want to buy Maggi or pepper or something of 500 naira and you want to use bitcoin, it is very funny.On the other hand if you are talking about big traders that has goods from 30k up, which are not petty traders, they will accept bitcoin with time,when they see that bitcoin is gaining ground in the country and people are saying all sorts of benefits in using bitcoin. Especially those marketers that deal on foreign goods, they will gladly embrace bitcoin because it has save them the stress of using a third party for payment and they can send bitcoin at their own convenience. So it all depends on the kind of marketers that we are talking about.
